markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Studded Leather Armor](/Armor.aspx?ID=5)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 3 gp

**AC Bonus** +2

**Dex Cap** +3

**Check Penalty** -1

**Speed Penalty** —
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** 12

**Bulk** 1

**Category** Light

**Group** Leather
</row>

</column>

---

This leather armor is reinforced with metal studs and sometimes small metal plates, providing most of the flexibility of leather armor with more robust protection.

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-3" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Devil's Bargain](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1844), [Fungal Armor](/Equipment.aspx?ID=887), [Jerkin of Liberation](/Equipment.aspx?ID=663), [Spangled Rider's Suit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=591), [Wasp Guard](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1855)
name: Studded Leather Armor
